definition: to release/to set free/to allow (a person or an animal) to go/to liberate
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Why did he let the British army go at Dunkirk?
sentences.chinese: 他爲什麼要放走在敦克爾克的英國部隊？

sentences.english: Then I released the shutter and set the firefly free.
sentences.chinese: 然後我關掉快門，把螢火蟲放走了。

sentences.english: So the maid made up her mind and let the turtle go.
sentences.chinese: 所以丫環下了決心，要放走烏龜。

sentences.english: Instead it is an active desire not to let go.
sentences.chinese: 但它是主動的慾望，不放走。

sentences.english: Manchester City may regret letting Daniel Sturridge slip away.
sentences.chinese: 曼城或許會後悔放走斯圖裏奇。

sentences.english: You have to give me the explaination you release Abel Nightroad, Sister. Aldgate.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾蓋特修女，你需要給我放走亞伯的原因。

sentences.english: If the hunters were there, Huineng cried and begged them to release the animals.
sentences.chinese: 如果獵人們在場，慧能就哭着求他們把動物放走。

sentences.english: The thief did not get off lightly and was sentenced to ten years in jail.
sentences.chinese: 小偷並沒有被輕率地放走，而是被處罰坐牢十年。

sentences.english: He let out the bird from the cage.
sentences.chinese: 他把鳥從籠子裏放走了。

sentences.english: Werder Bremen have been adamant they will not release the Brazilian, but his position is very clear.
sentences.chinese: 雲達不萊梅一直堅稱不想放走迭戈，但他去意已決。

sentences.english: The German consul William Liu Yunxiang hostage, to let the money for Henry han.
sentences.chinese: 劉雲翔挾持德國領事威廉，欲放走錢漢光換回亨利。

sentences.english: Chelsea have also released the defender Juliano Belletti.
sentences.chinese: 而且安切洛蒂還放走了後衛貝萊蒂。

sentences.english: Someday, someone is going to thank you for having let me go.
sentences.chinese: 會有那麼一天，有人要感謝你，虧得你放走了我。

sentences.english: Your communication skills will help you in rounding this person up -- and you refuse to let this one get away!
sentences.chinese: 交流技巧讓你左右逢源，更不會輕易放走這個人。

definition: to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
under one's control or administration/subordinates/(money etc) on hand/sb's financial means/to take action
to run away/to take to one's heels
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
hands tied and waiting to be captured
